meanings.definition: To establish a colony in or on
meanings.sent1: The explorers decided to colonialize the new land they discovered.
meanings.sent2: Many countries in the past have tried to colonialize distant territories.
meanings.sent3: The idea to colonialize the uninhabited island seemed like a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her dream was to colonialize the barren land and turn it into a thriving community.
meanings.sent5: The settlers worked hard to colonialize the wild frontier and build a new home.

meanings.sent1: The powerful empire sought to colonialize weaker nations for resources.
meanings.sent2: During the Age of Exploration, many indigenous peoples were colonialized by European powers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended to colonialize their backyard and declare it a new country.
meanings.sent4: The oppressive regime aimed to colonialize the neighboring regions and expand its control.
meanings.sent5: The conquerors used force to colonialize the native tribes and impose their authority.

meanings.sent1: The architecture of the building was colonialized to reflect the historical period.
meanings.sent2: The influence of the colonial powers colonialized the local traditions and customs.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer decided to colonialize the runway with vintage-inspired clothing.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work aimed to colonialize modern art with traditional techniques.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant's decor was colonialized to transport diners back in time to a bygone era.
